ai.summary: Marshall Country Trail is a challenging long-distance hike in the UK, spanning approximately 26.8 km and designed for experienced hikers seeking a strenuous day on the trail.
ai.terrain_summary: The route features varied UK terrain: forest tracks, rural lanes, and fields, with uneven surfaces and occasional mud. Expect both gentle stretches and steeper sections; weather can affect footing.
ai.safety_notes: Always check the forecast, carry a map and compass or GPS, and inform someone of your plan before you go. Wear sturdy boots and dress in layers; bring enough water and snacks; carry a basic first aid kit and a whistle. Start early to ensure daylight, and know your limits—if conditions worsen, turn back.
recommended_gear: Map and compass or GPS device
Lightweight rain cover for your bag
ai.best_seasons: Spring to autumn (roughly March–October) are ideal for this trail; winter hikes are possible with extra gear, shorter daylight, and careful planning.

seo.title: Marshall Country Trail – 26.8 km Hard Hike in the UK
seo.meta_description: Discover the Marshall Country Trail, a 26.8 km hard hike in the UK. Get terrain insights, safety tips, and gear recommendations for a challenging day on the trail.
